entries: As {@creature anadi hunter|aoa1}.
bot.name: Change Shape

entries: As {@creature anadi hunter|aoa1}.
bot.name: Spin Silk
Change Shape
entries: The anadi changes into their true form, spider form, or human form. The above statistics assume the anadi is in their true form. While in their human form, the anadi hunter can't use their fangs attack and loses their climb Speed. When in spider form, they can't use weapons.

bot.name: Spin Silk
entries: By spending several minutes, an anadi can produce silk to craft items made of cloth. A single anadi can produce enough silk in a day to craft a single garment.
+8, {@skill Diplomacy} +10, {@skill Nature} +12, {@skill Survival} +10 Str +0, Dex +2, Con +0, Int +1, Wis +4, Cha +2 Items hide armor, shortsword.
top.name: Deception

entries: As {@creature anadi hunter|aoa1}.
bot.name: Change Shape

entries: As {@creature anadi hunter|aoa1}.
bot.name: Spin Silk

entries: +6, {@skill Survival} +4, {@skill Thievery} +6 Str +4, Dex +3, Con +1, Int +0, Wis +1, Cha –1 Items longsword, shortbow (20 arrows), studded leather, 15 sp.
top.name: Stealth

entries: The first time the mercenary hits their hunted prey in a round, they deal {@dice 1d8} additional precision damage.
bot.name: Precision

entries: +7, {@skill Intimidation} +7, {@skill Lore||Mercantile Lore} +4
top.name: Deception

entries: +7, {@skill Stealth} +11, {@skill Thievery} +11 Str +2, Dex +4, Con +1, Int –1, Wis –1, Cha +2 Items dagger, leather armor, lesser healing potion (2), +1 shortbow (20 arrows), thieves' tools.
top.name: Society

entries: Advantage Calmont isn't {@condition flat-footed} to {@condition hidden}, {@condition undetected}, or flanking creatures of level 3 or lower.
mid.name: Deny

entries: Attack Calmont deals {@damage 1d6} extra damage to flatfooted creatures.
bot.name: Sneak

entries: If Calmont used {@skill Deception} or {@skill Stealth} for initiative, creatures that haven't acted are {@condition flat-footed} to Calmont on the first round of combat.
bot.name: Surprise Attack

entries: Dmira's multiple attack penalty against her hunted prey is –3 (–2 with an agile weapon) on her second attack and –6 (–4 with an agile weapon) on her third or subsequent attacks.
bot.name: Flurry

mid.trigger: An enemy hits the doorwarden with a melee {@action Strike}.
entries: The doorwarden can Raise its Shield and gain its shield's benefit to AC against the triggering attack.
mid.name: Reactive Shield

entries: When the doorwarden uses Shield Block against a melee attack from a creature within 5 feet, it can also push the creature 5 feet.
mid.name: Shield Block

entries: Until the next time it acts, the doorwarden appears to be a door. It has an automatic result of 31.
bot.name: Imitate Door

entries: {@skill Deception} checks and DCs to pass as a door.
bot.name: on

entries: The door opens and slams its doors, making two door {@action Strike||Strikes} against one creature. If both hit, the creature is {@condition grabbed}—stuck between the doors. The doorwarden's multiple attack penalty doesn't increase until it has finished both attacks.
bot.name: Slam Doors

entries: The emperor bird flaps its mesmerizing wings. Each creature within 15 feet that can see the emperor bird must attempt a DC 19 Will save.

entries.Success: The creature is {@condition dazzled} for 1 round.
entries.Failure: The creature is {@condition dazzled} for {@dice 1d4} rounds.
entries.Critical Failure: The creature is {@condition confused} for {@dice 1d4} rounds.

bot.name: Dazzling Display

entries: The emperor bird makes tail {@action Strike||Strikes} against two different creatures within reach. The emperor bird's multiple attack penalty does not increase until it has finished both attacks.
bot.name: Tail Lash

mid.trigger: The grauladon takes damage from an adjacent creature.
entries: The grauladon uses Noxious Breath, including the triggering creature in the area.
mid.name: Reactive Breath

bot.requirements: More than one enemy is adjacent to the grauladon.
entries: The grauladon swings its tail at each adjacent enemy and attempts.
bot.name: Body Slam

entries: {@action Trip} each creature adjacent to it. It rolls only a single {@skill Athletics} check and compares the result to the Fortitude DC of each target.
bot.name: to

entries: A grauladon can hold its breath for 225 rounds (22-1/2 minutes).
bot.name: Deep Breath

entries: The grauladon hisses and unleashes a nauseating cloud of halitosis in a 15-foot cone. Each creature in the area must succeed at a DC 18 Fortitude saving throw or be {@condition sickened|CRB|sickened 1} ({@condition sickened|CRB|sickened 2} on a critical failure). The grauladon can't use.
bot.name: Noxious Breath

entries: for {@dice 1d4} rounds.
bot.name: Noxious Breath or Reactive Breath

entries: The graveshell conceals its true nature over the course of a few minutes by impaling a corpse (typically humanoid) on its spiky shell before partially submerging itself in water. It has an automatic result of 22 on {@skill Deception} checks and DCs to pass as a corpse floating in the water.
top.name: Corpse Disguise

mid.trigger: The graveshell takes damage from a physical attack while withdrawn into its shell (see Shell Game below).
entries: The graveshell reduces the damage from the attack by an amount equal to its shell's Hardness. A graveshell's shell has a Hardness of 6, 10 Hit Points, and a {@condition Broken} Threshold of 5. If its shell is {@condition broken}, the graveshell can't attack with shell spikes, nor can it use Shell Game. If the shell is destroyed, the graveshell's AC is reduced to 16. As long as a graveshell is alive, its shell naturally repairs itself after a week.
mid.name: Shell Block

entries: The graveshell can hold its breath for 200 rounds (20 minutes).
bot.name: Deep Breath

entries: The graveshell withdraws into its shell, gaining a +2 circumstance bonus.
bot.name: Shell Game

entries: AC and allowing it to use Shell Block. This lasts until the graveshell moves or attacks with any attack other than its shell spikes. The graveshell can't take this action or get any benefit from it if its shell is {@condition broken}.
bot.name: to

entries: If the hellcrown hits with a nail {@action Strike}, the target must attempt a DC 16 Fortitude save. On a failure, the nail is embedded in the creature, making it {@condition enfeebled|CRB|enfeebled 1} for 1 minute and giving it 1 {@condition persistent damage ||persistent bleed damage} ({@condition enfeebled|CRB|enfeebled 2} and {@damage 1d4} {@condition persistent damage ||persistent bleed damage} on a critical failure). Each additional embedded nail increases the {@condition enfeebled} value by 1 (to a maximum of {@condition enfeebled|CRB|enfeebled 4}) and the bleed damage by 1. A creature can remove a nail with an {@action Interact} action to reduce the enfeeblement and amount of bleed damage. Pulling out the last nail removes both conditions.
bot.name: Bleeding Nail

entries: All creatures that can see the hellcrown and are suffering from its bleeding nail must attempt a DC 16 Will saving throw.

A creature that fails is {@condition frightened|CRB|frightened 1}, and on a critical failure becomes {@condition fleeing} for as long as it's {@condition frightened}. Any creature that attempts a save is then temporarily immune for 10 minutes.
bot.name: Terrifying Stare

attacks.name: Cinderclaw gauntlet
attacks.damage: {@damage 2d4+5} piercing plus {@damage 1d6} fire on a critical hit

entries: +13, {@skill Stealth} +8 Str +3, Dex +2, Con +2, Int +0, Wis +4, Cha +2 Items +1 chain shirt, Cinderclaw gauntlet (page 77), gold religious symbol of {@deity Dahak|LOGM} (worth 20 gp), hatchet, hunter's arrowhead (page 77)
top.name: Religion

entries: As charau-ka; see page 37.
bot.name: Shrieking Frenzy

entries: As charau-ka; see page 37.
bot.name: Thrown Weapon Mastery

entries: +7, {@skill Medicine} +12, {@skill Nature} +10
top.name: Deception

entries: +10, {@skill Survival} +10 Str +0, Dex +2, Con +0, Int +2, Wis +4, Cha +1.
top.name: Stealth

entries: Saving Throw DC 20 Fortitude
bot.name: Anadi Venom

entries: 4 rounds; Stage 1 {@damage 1d6} poison damage and {@condition flat-footed} (1 round); Stage 2 {@damage 1d6} poison damage, {@condition flat-footed}, and {@condition clumsy|CRB|clumsy 1} (1 round)
bot.name: Maximum Duration

entries: As {@creature anadi hunter|aoa1} (page 84).
bot.name: Change Shape

entries: As {@creature anadi hunter|aoa1} (page 84).
bot.name: Spin Silk

entries: The skeletal Hellknight can direct the actions of the nearby skeleton guards, commanding them to perform tactics such as flanking foes and focusing their attacks on specific targets. As long as the skeletal Hellknight is active and commanding the skeletons, they gain the {@action Attack of Opportunity} reaction.
bot.name: Command Skeletons

bot.trigger: The skeletal Hellknight hits a foe with a {@action Strike}.
entries: The skeletal Hellknight causes the creature struck to endure the pain of an Order of the Nail's reckoning—a rite of mortification Hellknights of that order use to focus their minds. The creature struck feels as if nails are being driven into their body, and must succeed at a DC 17 Will save or be {@condition stunned|CRB|stunned 1} from the pain. On a critical failure, the pain manifests as actual puncture wounds, dealing an additional {@dice 2d6} points of piercing damage to the victim.
bot.name: Invoke Reckoning

entries: The charau-ka is {@condition quickened} until the end of its turn, and can use the extra action to {@action Stride} or {@action Strike}. Due to its loud wailing while in a shrieking frenzy, the charau-ka can't speak and automatically critically fails all {@skill Stealth} checks.
bot.name: Shrieking Frenzy

entries: When a charau-ka throws a weapon, the weapon gains the {@trait deadly <d6>} weapon trait. When it throws an improvised weapon, it doesn't take the –2 penalty for using an improvised weapon, nor does it take the penalty for using that weapon to make a lethal attack instead of a nonlethal attack.
bot.name: Thrown Weapon Mastery

entries: +9, {@skill Stealth} +10 Str +3, Dex +3, Con +2, Int +0, Wis +2, Cha –1.
top.name: Spider Lore

entries: The tixitog can detect the vibrations of creatures touching a web that the tixitog is also touching.
top.name: Web Sense

entries: Small, {@damage 1d12+3} bludgeoning, Rupture 10.
bot.name: Swallow Whole

entries: When a tixitog hits a Small or smaller creature with its tongue {@action Strike}, the target is pulled into the tixitog's mouth.
The tixitog can then attempt to Swallow it Whole.
bot.name: Tongue Pull

entries: When Voz uses this ability, she also regains 1 Focus Point.
bot.name: Drain Bonded Item

entries: +7, {@skill Survival} +3 Str –1, Dex +2, Con +2, Int +2, Wis +0, Cha +3 Items book titled History of the Bumblebrashers in Isger, religious symbol of {@deity Desna}, scholar's robes.
top.name: Society

top.trigger: A goblin ally ends a move action adjacent to Warbal.
entries: Warbal {@action Step||Steps}.
top.name: Goblin Scuttle
